column2: {'id': 21403630, 'body': "Hi there! Thank you so much for your love! Your review inspires our team to grow and become one of the best budgeting apps. Please, reach out anytime at support@pocketguard.com if you'd like to share any thoughts or have any questions about the app. Have a wonderful day.", 'modified': '2021-03-02T17:10:27Z'}
column3:
Let me tell you- all of the previous reviews are old. I‚Äôve been on this app for the since 2019 & will honestly be here until I die. Hoping it lasts that long. üôèüèΩ I‚Äôve been searching for a way to understand my spendings between categories, month over month & watching my budget. This is everything & more. I love the personalization that I can add my own catergories, mark a specific merchant as something once and never have to touch it again & even exclude things like transactions between my accounts. This is the app if you‚Äôre anal about how you spend your money & it even helps if I want to budget for let‚Äôs say shopping. I love it. Please note I am a premium user & to me it‚Äôs worth it. But I‚Äôm sure the free version is equally as good. The other apps mint, your bank, random ones only work if you have a goal. But for me, I want to know where, what & compare my spendings month over month so I can see how I‚Äôm doing. Or if I need to stop spending! 

Anyway highly recommend. And two last things- 1) they‚Äôre IT or support literally responds within 48 hours. You‚Äôre never left hanging and no question is stupid. 2) the app is constantly evolving. It‚Äôs not the same as it was two years ago, it‚Äôs better! If there‚Äôs a bug, report it! If you have a suggestion, suggest it! I love all the latest updates & it really helps me think of how I‚Äôm spending my money which was my ultimate goal. Thank you!!
column7: Going on 2+ years: you will not regret

column2: {'id': 34014529, 'body': 'Hi there! Thank you for the fantastic review! Our team is pleased to hear you enjoy using our application for your budgeting needs. Feel free to contact us at support@pocketguard.com if you have any suggestions or questions. Have a great day!', 'modified': '2022-12-30T15:52:33Z'}
column3: I‚Äôve literally never written a review for an app before, but I had to because I felt so strongly about the quality of this app. I used mint for a long time bc it was free and got the job done, but recently, Mint stopped supporting my bank (USAA). So, I was on the market for a new budgeting app and stumbled upon PocketGuard. I have to say, I‚Äôm extremely impressed. I love the ability to save for my goals without having to think about it. I love how it calculates my estimated monthly income so that I don‚Äôt have to do the mental math when it comes to budgeting. I love the notifications it gives me when I spend too much on a particular category. I love the customizable budget categories (not an option under Mint). This is truly the greatest budgeting app I‚Äôve ever used, and I‚Äôve been budgeting my money very persistently for about a decade now. Also, the customer service is probably the best I‚Äôve ever come into contact with, across any business or platform. You have a question? Email them and you‚Äôll get a response back within 24 hours. In fact I emailed them once with a question and received a response back within 30 minutes. Overall, this is a fantastic budgeting app and I couldn‚Äôt recommend it more.

column2: {'id': 23671103, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for your feedback. Please, contact us at support@pocketguard.com and specify the name of the financial institution where your checking account keeps disconnecting. Also, it would be extremely helpful if you could send us the merchant name and the categorization rule applied to this merchant, so we could investigate the issue further. Hope for your understanding.', 'modified': '2021-06-30T08:44:38Z'}
column3: I‚Äôve tried 5 or 6 apps over the years. PocketGuard is the best. I like that I can just assess daily spending, not investments. It is easy enough to use that I do use it, and catching up is easy if I get behind. The team responds to questions quickly and have always answered my questions. There is one merchant that entries frequently default to, even when they are repeated expenditures that PocketGuard should have learned by now. I would like to see a yearly view of my spending categories in addition to monthly; hopefully that is planned. One small thing I would like is to see a number for total food (groceries and eating out combined) somewhere. I am always tracking that, as it‚Äôs the most important area to control. I really like the split transaction feature they added. Overall, PocketGuard has made a dramatic difference in understanding my spending and controlling it. I think I‚Äôve used it for 4 years now and that‚Äôs a record for any financial app except Excel or a brokerage site.

column2: {'id': 47607577, 'body': 'Hello, thank you for your thoughtful feedback! We are truly sorry for the persistent challenges with bank syncing. These issues often occur when banks implement updates to their systems or security protocols, which can disrupt our integration. Additionally, we collaborate with data providers to facilitate syncing with multiple financial institutions, and they may experience delays while adjusting to these changes. We recognize how inconvenient this can be and are working closely with our data providers to improve the stability of these connections. Thank you for your patience and for being a valued customer.', 'modified': '2024-10-21T20:51:07Z'}
column3:
The app overall is great and their customer support is quick to respond. I love that it helps get basic budgeting answers done. My biggest problem is the lack of compatibility with other banks. For months, my Marcus accounts refused to sync, and even though Pocketguards customer service was responsive, the issue took literal months to fix. Everything worked fine for another two months, and then my local bank stopped syncing, and the customer service gave me the same response.

I appreciate the communication and hard work, but when your banks constantly don‚Äôt sync with the app, the app becomes ineffective. Whenever the app finally reconnects to my bank, I‚Äôll have to go back and play catch-up on all my transactions while operating in the dark in the mean time. Now, with this happening twice, I‚Äôll just be paranoid when the next time one of my banks no longer syncs up with PocketGuard. 

Again, it‚Äôs a good app, so maybe I‚Äôm just unlucky, but when your app doesn‚Äôt sync with the banks, it becomes pointless, especially when you spend a large chunk of money on the app itself.

column2: {'id': 41809132, 'body': 'Hi there! Thank you very much for your valuable feedback! Our team is so pleased to hear that your family enjoys the app. By the way, it would also be helpful if you could rate us on Trustpilot: https://www.trustpilot.com/review/pocketguard.com', 'modified': '2024-02-07T08:27:53Z'}
column3:
Can I just start off by saying I downloaded and tried using so many budgeting apps. I did lots of research to find the best rated apps and tried them all. I found this app and I will never look back! 
I needed a budgeting app that would track my spending, track my savings goals, and clearly show me where I was going over. This app does it all. I also do a lot of transferring money from one account to another, I‚Äôve had trouble tracking this on other apps. PocketGuard let‚Äôs you easily hide transfers so they don‚Äôt confuse your budget. Same goes for credit card payments or other random charges I don‚Äôt want counted towards my spending or savings goals. The app also gives you a breakdown of your month with pie charts and statistics. It also lays out all the information I need in a clear way that makes it easy to understand. My husband and I both love this app and plan on using it for many years to come.
column7: The BEST budgeting app out there

column2: {'id': 41354594, 'body': 'Hi there! Thank you very much for your amazing 5-star review! Our team would so much appreciate it if you could also share your love on our Trustpilot account. You can simply mark your CC transfers (payments from one account to another) as "don\'t count" to exclude them from the calculation, but if you still would like to count those as expenses, you can include your debit transaction in calculations to deduct from your In My Pocket. Feel free to contact us at support@pocketguard.com in case of any concerns or questions.', 'modified': '2024-01-17T20:27:00Z'}
column3:
I‚Äôve tried all the budgeting apps and felt that each one was missing a key feature that others had, but none had everything. I was just about to compromise and settle for one, but luckily I tried PocketGuard! If you took only the good features from all of the different budgeting apps and packaged them together perfectly, then you‚Äôd have PocketGuard! It has really helped me to see my spending habits, especially as a recovering ‚Äúswipe now, worry later‚Äù kind of spender. Never trying anything else again and their prices are also much more affordable than other apps! 

One feature I‚Äôd love to see though is the option for credit card payment due amounts being included as a bill. That way I can budget for money leftover after bills + cc payments needed. I know this isn‚Äôt useful for those that don‚Äôt carry balances, but for those of us that do, this would make budgeting so much more accurate.

Say you pull the minimum payment amount from each statement as they‚Äôre issued (since the amount can vary month to month) and it would show up as an Upcoming Bill and also deducted from In My Pocket. I‚Äôd also like to see the ability to mark smaller payments throughout the month as amounts towards the minimum payment amount so it shows the remaining.

Thanks and excited to see future updates!

column2: {'id': 48004952, 'body': "Hi, and thank you for bringing this to our attention. We understand how concerning it must be. While we‚Äôre working closely with our data provider to fix the sync issue, we want to acknowledge your question about deleting the bank connection. If you decide to proceed, please be aware that this will remove all transaction history and custom settings tied to that bank. If you'd like to discuss this further or explore alternative solutions, please contact us at support@pocketguard.com. The team would be happy to assist you in making the best choice for your needs.", 'modified': '2024-11-06T22:07:03Z'}
column3:
PocketGuard has acknowledged that an issue with their data provider is causing a sync problem with one of my banks. This started more than a week ago. The impact of this issue is that the bank is locking me out every single day   due to failed login attempts. The app does not provide an option to delete banks. After asking support how to delete the back and getting no acknowledgement of the question, I discovered on my own that you can log in to the website through a browser to delete banks. However, the delete option is grayed out on the bank with the sync issue.

Tech support just tells me they‚Äôre working on it, no ETA, they‚Äôll let me know when they learn something, but does not acknowledge my question any deleting that bank so I stop getting locked out while they work on it. This is completely unacceptable. 

I generally like the app, but it‚Äôs not worth being locked out by banks.
column7: Keeps locking me out of my bank

column2:
{'id': 28588786, 'body': 'Hi Claire! We are so much happy that both you and your husband found PocketGuard helpful in your budgeting needs.

1) Our team has already started working on the big update regarding category budgets. Your voice has been heard. 
2) Please, contact us at support@pocketguard.com, so we could send you detailed instructions on how to handle this case.
3) This case should be reported to our data aggregation provider, so please contact us at support@pocketguard.com once the posted transactions will be missing from the app again.

Have a great day!', 'modified': '2022-03-15T15:27:19Z'}
column3:
This app has made it so easy to see where our money has gone and is going to go. My new husband and I decided to share accounts and we were struggling to relax into that after independently controlling our finances for so long‚Ä¶ this has made it so much easier! I had to contact customer support one time and they were incredibly prompt and helpful. I knocked off a star because I wish it was able to do the following (but would have only knocked off only half a star if it was an option):

1) I wish you could choose to carry over unspent budgets to the next month. ie If I underspend this month on ‚Äòhome‚Äô, the budget is bigger the following month to purchase a more expensive item.

2) I wish it could learn and adapt. We pay two bills to Banfield Pet Plan each month that come up as BP. When we buy gas from BP, it goes into bills because it think it‚Äôs the same. So a couple of times a month, I have to manuallly change names and categories - sometimes I have to re-enter the banfield bills and then, when they are paid, they don‚Äôt register as the ones planned. This is a niche and minor issue but slightly annoying nonetheless.

3) I wish it was a little more prompt in identifying new transactions. Sometimes the banking app will detail transactions as no longer pending and it‚Äôll take a day or two for them to appear on PocketGuard.

These are minor things that I‚Äôd like the developers to consider BUT overall I love this app!

column2: {'id': 41756580, 'body': 'Hi there! Sorry for the inconvenience. Seems like you were running out of daily available connection attempts. This restriction is made to prevent fraud attacks like credential stuffing. One of our main goals is to guarantee the security of your financial information. Regarding syncing issues - please contact us at support@pocketguard.com, so we can analyze your case and troubleshoot. Hope for your understanding.', 'modified': '2024-02-05T10:41:48Z'}
column3:
I used to love this app. Tracking was amazing but over the last few mo thank keep getting issues with updating or it deleting my info. I tried to connect my bank I don‚Äôt keep getting error messages then it tells me I got to wait 24 hours to check again. Or Info not updating at all. I‚Äôm over it I will spend my money else where.

PS. I ran out of daily available attempts because your system wouldn‚Äôt allow me. When I tried it would say oops try again and when I didn‚Äôt said I ran out. I find it funny that some one could respond to the review but no one has ever emailed me back about the issue I contacted you guys about. No worries, I have already cancelled my subscription and found another app.

As many people have said it that the app is very good. It logs for most parts of it accurately all the expenses better than other budgeting apps. However where it lags really behind is that they have not figured out a good partnership with the major banks and credit cards on how to get the synchronization perfected to be able to download the transactions seamlessly. I have problems with PNC and American Express. These are two bigger reputable institutions. I hope pocketguard really talks with those institutions and gets this fixed.

If they can get it fixed which I don‚Äôt see why they can‚Äôt  I will surely give them 5 stars. It‚Äôs like the restaurant has a very good atmosphere but if the food is bad somebody may not want to go back. Similarly the app is super good however if the synchronization keeps failing time to time people are going to have to decide and leave because without the transactions being able to be downloaded the app is no good which is so good in other ways. Please please fix. I am counting on PoxketGuard to come through it. Thanks
column7: Great app but accounts don‚Äôt sync

column3:
As a career banker and someone with an MBA, I found this app extremely difficult to use. It double counted many things which was an effect of using both the recurring bills category and budget tracking. This was not apparent at set up and I could not get it to right itself, even making recurring items inactive and asking for assistance from customer service, who also was not helpful.

At the end of the month, it showed that I had a negative number left in my pocket, which was incorrect, but then when I added a paycheck as income for that period it went negative thousands more‚Ä¶how can that even occur mathematically and in a user-friendly experience?

Do not recommend! Going back to the Dave Ramsey app.

column2: {'id': 42045781, 'body': 'Hi there! Thank you very much for your wonderful review! Our team is so pleased to hear you enjoy using PocketGuard. It would be also helpful if you could rate us on Trustpilot here: https://www.trustpilot.com/review/pocketguard.com', 'modified': '2024-02-19T09:14:15Z'}
column3:
I came across PocketGuard when looking for a replacement budgeting app after finding out Mint was being shuttered. I had been using Mint for over 7 years and had got used to it. Although I was skeptical that I could get used to a brand new budgeting app I quickly found PG to not just be as good as Mint, but better in almost every way!

I like that they offer a one-time lifetime purchase as I despise monthly subscriptions. The best feature in PG is the recurring income and bills. With Mint I often had problems remembering those quarterly or yearly bills and they‚Äôd throw off my whole budget. With PG I never have to worry about forgetting them because they‚Äôre always scheduled. It‚Äôs also helpful to be able to see next month‚Äôs estimated bills and income. 

Highly recommend PocketGuard to any fellow budgeters!

column3:
Longtime Mint user here, given the circumstances of Mint shutting down I‚Äôve been on the hunt for a new budgeting app that allows me to gain insights into my money. Here are top things I did not like about this app.  1. My account aren‚Äôt organized. I‚Äôd like to be able to see a collapsed view of my checking and savings amount but also be able to see them broken out. On the accounts view tab I would see a credit card then a savings account then a checking account from another bank- just no organization.
2. There were a few credit cards I was not able to link. Using the premium version to limit all of my credit cards is critical for me as it allows me to gain a complete view of my finances- especially with subscriptions on certain cards.
3. Cancelling the subscription is NOT the easiest. I was still within the 7 day trial period to cancel but I still have wasn‚Äôt sure if I wasn‚Äôt going to be changed since I signed up on the web

Feel free to contact us at support@pocketguard.com in case of any concerns. Have a wonderful day!", 'modified': '2024-01-17T08:45:47Z'}
column3: This app is by far one of the best.  Love the goals and debit payoff. No other budget app has it.  A few things tend to throw everything off tho. 1. Not being about to mark as and ‚Äúearly pay‚Äù for the next month. A lot of times my pay post early in my bank, so most of the time toward the end of the month. It post the income in the wrong month that it should be in. 2. Rollover option should be available especially when trying to save up for goals and budget caps.  3. A better 3rd party partner for small banks/connecting accounts.  Most of my transactions come from a smaller bank doing everything manually kind of takes out the purpose of the app. These are  the only things  me from keeping my subscription. I‚Äôll always check back and keep an eye on this app, though just to see if they have any good updates.
column7: Almost there  just a few more

Be assured that your request is heard, and we will discuss possible ways to improve the app in this matter. Have a great day!\r', 'modified': '2022-08-08T11:35:27Z'}
column3: Finally! An app that let‚Äôs me track my expenses real time‚Ä¶and accurately! I have tried 14 other budgeting apps in the last year and each one had something buggy about it, or the process flow didn‚Äôt make sense. I used to use Mint but there are too many problems with syncing transactions, etc. This app does all the things I expected the other apps to do and has other cute features (icons for each budget). I‚Äôm sticking with this one from now on. After playing with it for a few hours I bought the annual subscription which is reasonable compared to the other apps I‚Äôve tried. My only request is that the Spending and Budgeting screen should be easier to get to once the app opens, since I use it daily to make sure I‚Äôm staying within each budget category.

column2:
{'id': 45816724, 'body': "Hi there,

Thank you for your positive review!

We're thrilled to hear that PocketGuard has been a fantastic tool for your financial planning.

Your feedback about the year-to-date spending feature is valuable, and our product team is aware of this request and working on it.

If you have any other suggestions or need assistance, feel free to reach out.

Thanks again for your support!", 'modified': '2024-08-07T09:23:26Z'}
column3:
I've been using this app for about 6 months. It's fantastic
I didn't really need an app to plan my financial future, I just wanted to conveniently see what our family is spending money on across all credit cards and bank accounts. This is exactly what this app does in a clear, concise way.  Transactions are automatically assigned categories with good accuracy and you can edit them, create your own, and  include or exclude categories in calculations.  Actually one of our cards was fraudulently used for 2 airline tickets which I was able to notice immediately and rectify thanks to the app. 

 I also wanted an app without a monthly subscription which most other top rated apps have.  I paid for the premium app which is a one time, very reasonable fee.  

One issue is the app really isn't set up as well to track year to date spending. Easy fix though- I have an excel sheet which includes all the categories I enter in less than 5 minutes once a month. This actually leads to another positive though.  The app team is absolutely fantastic about responding to issues and suggestions for improvements. I believe they are about to add a year to date feature and just recently Apple cards are now trackable.

I needed an app that would allow me to setup budget categories and monitor my spending (based on accounts I linked to it). It does that and it does it fairly well. I do have to constantly go in everyday to update the category for which it falls in, but I‚Äôm just very particular in how I want my expenditures categorized. I may try using the hashtag feature to simplify things. I also like how it notifies you when you get close to hitting your limits. Moreover it‚Äôs all free! There‚Äôs a paid version to unlock more features, but for me those aren‚Äôt necessary. 

The only downside I‚Äôve noticed is that it doesn‚Äôt update or show your expenditures in real time. Meaning, I usually have to wait 2-3 days before an expense is posted which can be frustrating when needing to know where you stand at any given moment in terms of your budget... which is sort of the purpose of the app right?

This app is great if you want something very basic to track your expenses. Bank accounts sync flawlessly, and it is easy to make a custom budget and track purchases.

Where it needs work though is in the integration of the ‚ÄúSpending Limits‚Äù category into the rest of the app. For some reason they have 2 separate categories for ‚ÄúBills‚Äù and ‚ÄúSpending Limits.‚Äù I am sure most people, like me, primarily use the ‚ÄúSpending Limits‚Äù portion which is not really used for any data integration in the rest of the app.

I would like to see ‚ÄúSpending Limits‚Äù integrated into the ‚ÄúOverview‚Äù tab and future monthly income accounted for in the ‚ÄúOverview‚Äù space. It would also be nice to see some changes made in the ‚ÄúInsights‚Äù tab. Ideally, ‚ÄúSpending Limits‚Äù would be broken into macro categories and these macro categories would comprise the pieces of the pie chart under ‚ÄúInsights.‚Äù

I really like the idea of having an app that tells you how much is safe to spend without endangering your bills money. It does a pretty good job of categorizing automatically, the need to re-categorize is minimal. However, it‚Äôs detecting one of my savings accounts as checking and I have found no way of changing that. Adding such function would be great. Also, maybe allowing us to add an expense for the future would be nice. I added money to the cash account, which was reserved for a transaction a few days into the future. It didn‚Äôt let me add anything for the future. So I‚Äôll have to come into the app when it happens in October and add it which doesn‚Äôt really make sense. Overall the apps is great, and it‚Äôs the closest I‚Äôve found to what I want which is an app like Level Money which is now gone. There is still room for a few improvements.

column2: {'id': 41152150, 'body': 'Hi there! Thank you for the review! Please contact us at support@pocketguard.com so that we can get additional information about your issues. Hope for your understanding and have a nice day!', 'modified': '2024-01-08T15:27:28Z'}
column3: Like many others, I had to make the transition from Mint, which wasn‚Äôt perfect, but I loved and used religiously for years. I love the debt payoff feature, even though I have to ‚Äúnot count‚Äù a lot of transactions to get the balance I have available in my bank account only. The reason it‚Äôs not getting 5 stars is because I‚Äôm experiencing some bugs with my accounts. One account will not connect and sends regular emails with verification codes that don‚Äôt work (even when I‚Äôm not trying to connect the account), another one is a loan that reflects the borrowed amount, not the current balance, and the last one I can‚Äôt find (even through Plaid). The whole reason I use these apps is so I can see all of my finances in one place, particularly my balances. Once I can achieve that, it will be perfect!

column2: {'id': 35510331, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for the fantastic review. We are glad to know you enjoy using the app. Our support team is happy to help you solve any issues you may have. Have a great day!', 'modified': '2023-03-21T18:13:52Z'}
column3:
PocketGuard is an excellent budgeting app that helps users keep track of their finances and manage their money with ease. The app's interface is user-friendly, and it offers a variety of features to help users stay on top of their spending habits, such as tracking bills, setting spending limits, and monitoring savings goals.

One of the standout features of PocketGuard is its exceptional customer service. The app's support team is highly responsive, friendly, and helpful. They provide prompt assistance to users who encounter issues or have questions about the app's features.

Many users also rave about the app's reliability and accuracy. PocketGuard pulls in data from bank accounts and credit cards to give users a comprehensive view of their financial situation. The app updates in real-time, so users can see their spending habits and account balances as they happen.

Overall, PocketGuard is a must-have app for anyone looking to get a better handle on their finances. It offers a range of features and tools to help users manage their money effectively, and its excellent customer service sets it apart from other budgeting apps on the market.

column2: {'id': 26881397, 'body': 'Hope you had an opportunity to check updated app?\nRate us if your needs satisfied! ', 'modified': '2021-12-16T20:45:46Z'}
column3: No split transactions. That is a huge problem. No way to balance your budget. You can set spending limits, but those numbers are not calculated. Total income - bills - savings goal - spending limits = monthly budget. There are Issues tracking savings transactions. If I transfer money from checking to an external savings, the transactions will show up as spending in the checking account and income in the savings account. Me transferring money to myself is not spending or income, and it messes up the totals in the income and spending categories. There is no way to fix that other than not including the transactions in the tally. If those issues are fixed, I will give this app 5 stars.
column7: Almost great. Major problems need to be fixed.

column3:
Worked for a month and I decided to purchase the premium version. A week after I purchased a year subscription one of my banks no longer updated. I contacted support and they explained it was something on their end and they could not provide a timeline as to when it would be fixed. It‚Äôs been two months now and it‚Äôs still not fixed and it‚Äôs too late to request a refund for purchasing the premium version. I would not recommend PocketGuard and if you do go month to month so you don‚Äôt run into the same situation I did. Regards.

06SEP2024 
I wanted to provide an update to my previous review. After working with PocketGuard support for a little over a month, he resolved all issues that I had. I no longer have any connection issues with my financial provider in PocketGuard has also provided updates to budgeting which I couldn‚Äôt find more useful I couldn‚Äôt be happier to have stuck with the PocketGuard with the help from their team.

I highly recommend PocketGuard to anyone wanting to do spend tracking in budgeting. Thank you to PocketGuard in the support team for all their help!!
column7: Worked for just over a month‚Ä¶. UPDATED

column3: Every transaction is placed into a specific category (in 9/10 cases it's accurate) so you have a great insight on how much you have spent on coffee shops and books, on clothing and sports etc. Having the full picture will help you to understand how do your spending habits look like now and how do you need to change them. To be honest, it was difficult to stay on budget even after a couple of months of using the app. I was really shocked when having seen my 'in my pocket' negative a week before the next month starts. I couldn't believe I'd overspent with my credit card so much... PocketGuard won't change your life, only you can do it. But this app is a great assistant which definitely makes this change go easier.
column7: Great assistant in managing your finances

column2: {'id': 43773408, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for your feedback. Please contact us at support@pocketguard.com, so we can review your issue with your Robinhood account and help you resolve it.', 'modified': '2024-05-08T06:30:17Z'}
column3:
As a premium user of PocketGuard, I've found it to be an invaluable tool for managing my finances. It offers excellent oversight of my accounts, helping me stay on top of my spending and savings goals effortlessly.

However, there's one persistent issue that has been bothering me for quite some time now: the inability to connect and display balances from my Robinhood investment account. No matter how many times I try to refresh it, the integration simply doesn't work. This problem has persisted since I became a premium user and hasn't been resolved despite my efforts.

Overall, PocketGuard is a fantastic app for financial management, but the ongoing issue with Robinhood integration detracts from its otherwise stellar performance. I hope the developers address this issue soon to provide a seamless experience for all users.
column7: Great Oversight, but Robinhood Integration Falls Short

column2: {'id': 42432858, 'body': 'Hi there! Thank you very much for your valuable feedback. We have already put most of the requests into our roadmap for 2024 and hope to improve PocketGuard to meet your expectations. Have a wonderful day and thanks for giving us a try. We will do our best to win you back as a customer one day :)', 'modified': '2024-03-07T08:46:43Z'}
column3:
There are simpler ways to do about things that I had expected. Sort of give more options to the users who wants it.

For one, there is no easy way to access any categories that I made without getting deep into each layer. I like to just categorize into whatever category I made but thats so so hard to access.

Second, for each category, there is no ‚Äòmoney in‚Äô tabs and ‚Äòmoney out‚Äô. So i dont know how much I received money on a particular category or so since there is no distinction.

Third, I like to see my spending details by month. I selected January then I saw my self made category and clicked it and I was presented with all the items that are in that particular category up till this day.

Fourth, if I don‚Äôt include a certain spending in any category, it will automatically put it into its own generated category (which is fine by me) but it is not shown in the ‚Äòoverview‚Äô tabs which is very frustrating.

I was giving this a try but now Im just contemplating into going back to just an excel sheet. I used Wallet by BudgetBakers before and I liked it except the fact that it can‚Äôt import csv pretty well w/o its own issues and some minor bugs. 

I just want more choices to those who wants better control of their finances instead of expecting the app to do it for them. Everyone is different.

I like the concept of PocketGuard, but there are a few elements missing to really make it good- being able to split transactions into different categories (not all my grocery store trips are just for groceries), constant bank connecting issues, and you need to upgrade to categorize certain things (gas, coffee shops, etc). I also noticed I only got push notifications AFTER opening the app- that kinda defeats the purpose of saying ‚Äúhey you‚Äôre close to your budget on ____ don‚Äôt overspend‚Äù. 

I do like that I could connect my main bank and see each account within in it including all of my different shares assigned to that account (checking, savings, trip savings, savings for Christmas, car loan, etc) and decide which to see every log in. The app is very esthetically pleasing and easy to navigate. I did google a few things to figure it how to do it.
column7: Good but is missing some key elements

column3: I absolutely love this app! I used to use the prism app but they started to have system issues and when I tried to address them, I would be waiting over a month to get a response. So I tried this  app called Pocket Guard.  I read a bunch of reviews on a what everyone considered ‚ÄúThe best finance apps‚Äù. This one stuck out to me the most. They really thought about the user interface and how the consumer would have to use the app. I thoroughly enjoy discovering all the features and information this app provides. I don‚Äôt need to use any other app once I set everything up. The customization of categories is such a great feature that I opted to pay the annual subscription rate. Great job Pocket Guard! üëçüèª‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

column2:
{'id': 44269353, 'body': "Hi there. We're sorry to hear about the difficulties you've experienced with linking your accounts.

We understand how important a smooth setup process is, and we appreciate your patience as you've worked through these issues. We would like to investigate this further to ensure you have the best possible experience with PocketGuard.

Please reach out to us at support@pocketguard.com so our team can assist you directly with linking your accounts and address any other concerns you might have.

Hope for your understanding.", 'modified': '2024-05-30T14:49:08Z'}
column3:
I loved Mint. I used it for years but like many I was left wandering the web finding a new financial planning tool after Mint‚Äôs questionable business decision.

I thought YNAB was too complicated and other planning apps are subscription based. I stumbled on this app after searching for ‚ÄúAffordable Budgeting Tools‚Äù

I thought I could manage with the free version of the app but I was shocked that they limited the number of accounts that can be linked to 2: one credit card and one bank account. For some this may be manageable but I had student loans and investment accounts I needed to link as well so I sprung for the yearly plan; if it‚Äôs good I‚Äôll swap to lifetime. If it doesn‚Äôt, I‚Äôll drop it. 

So far, I‚Äôve gotten a rocky impression. My first 2 links must have been flukes because linking all my other accounts has been nightmarishly slow. This app doesn‚Äôt use Plaid which is like the go to service for linking financial services. Instead it uses some other method by Mastercard which fails on the first try. I‚Äôd give the app a 1 but the developer was wise enough to include Plaid as a secondary. I‚Äôm still linking accounts after a couple days; usually it takes a couple hours to set up my finances on a new platform. Overall I‚Äôm not impressed but I‚Äôm hoping they can change my mind before the year is up.

column2: {'id': 44017824, 'body': "Hi there! I'm sorry for the inconvenience. Please contact me directly at ivan@pocketguard.com so that I can review your issue and assist you in resolving it. Hope for your understanding.", 'modified': '2024-05-20T06:17:42Z'}
column3: Buying the annual membership for this app was the worst mistake of my life. This app has CONSTANT SYNCING ISSUES with banking institutions rendering the app worthless. I noticed my Amex account not syncing since the beginning of March however I decided to be patient to see if devs would fix the issue and they never did. After looking at these reviews it appears other users have had the same problems and the developers have been aware since March only to add insult to injury. The app does not function as advertised and I‚Äôve requested refund. I‚Äôve contacted support for PocketGuard and have received no response. Please don‚Äôt waste your time this app and go look at Copilot or YNAB for budgeting.

column2: {'id': 41894461, 'body': 'Hi there! Thank you very much for your feedback!', 'modified': '2024-02-12T09:40:23Z'}
column3:
I as addicted to Mint and leveraged it to help tackle debt and control spending. As a single mom with a house and two kids, my finances have to be right. This tool is phenomenal and the product team is very approachable and friendly. In My Pocket is an awesome feature. 

Only suggestions for me after a couple months of near daily use: ensure the tab icons can be tapped to autoscroll back up - by nature some tabs have long scrolls so a quick jump up is helpful. On the donut chart and line chart for current spending it would also be helpful to show the diff dollar amount against 1 month ago spending, not just the full total from last month end against today. 

Really well done folks.

column2: {'id': 45238656, 'body': "Hi Mark. We apologize for the inconvenience you've experienced with PocketGuard. We understand how frustrating sync issues can be. Please contact our support team at support@pocketguard.com so we can investigate and resolve these issues for you. Your feedback is important to us, and we are committed to improving your experience. Thank you for your patience.", 'modified': '2024-07-13T08:34:09Z'}
column3: This app has been very disappointing.  It‚Äôs constantly unable to sync up with your external accounts.  It‚Äôs often displaying sync errors and asking you to reverify credentials, and then when you do, it‚Äôs usually unable to sync and asks you to try up to 5 times a day to provide data for a fix, and this usually goes on several days.  Then finally it will sync, so you assume the ‚Äúbug‚Äù has been fixed, but then a week or two later, the same issue with the same account reoccurs and you need to repeat the cycle.  Don‚Äôt buy this App!  I will not be renewing my subscription.

column2: {'id': 21236294, 'body': "Hi there! Sorry for the inconvenience. Updates may be delayed due to restrictions set by the financial institution, which don't allow us to sync balances in real-time or pull in pending transactions. Sometimes, pending transactions can be deleted or modified by the financial institution, so we'll not be able to match them with posted transactions. If there are posted transactions, that are not synced to PocketGuard for a while, please contact us at support@pocketguard.com, so we could request our data aggregation provider to troubleshoot.\r\n\r", 'modified': '2021-02-23T11:04:04Z'}
column3:
I reaallly want this app to be my go to budgeting tool. It has the best UI/UX of any app I‚Äôve ever tried, it‚Äôs so great to use. But unfortunately it just doesn‚Äôt sync up with your card transactions very well. 

I have ‚Äúpending transactions‚Äù from over a week ago that are definitely not pending anymore on my credit card. It also labels pending purchases with the incorrect vendor. I think PocketGuard has trouble with transactions that have tips? For example I went to a restaurant a week ago, but PocketGuard still says it‚Äôs pending and has the wrong merchant. It seems to mix up the merchant with previous purchases. Along with this, it‚Äôs missing some transactions from last week.

Mint doesn‚Äôt have this issue, all my transactions are there, none of them are incorrectly labeled as pending, and all the vendors are accurate.

There‚Äôs so many thing PocketGuard does right, but I can‚Äôt justify using it for budgeting when the transactions take forever to correct itself. I would gladly pay for a subscription if this wasn‚Äôt an issue. When it works, it works really well. 

Maybe I‚Äôll try again in a couple of months and see if anything improves. I really hope it does!!
column7: I want to love this app but transactions are too slow

column2: {'id': 26881376, 'body': '\nHope you will enjoy all features: bill organizer, debt payoff planner, budget planner, and bill tracker!\n', 'modified': '2021-12-16T20:43:33Z'}
column3: I was recommended to download this app three months ago but decided to leave a review only now. I didn't like the that categories are not totally customized at first, but then technical support gave me several hints on how to use their hashtags system. I wasn't sure it will work for me... But it did! I was able to create multiple spending reports with distinct categories without merging everything into one (#lifestyle report contained Sporting Goods + Gym + Food + Massage). Moreover, you can add multiple hashtags to one transaction and it will make the insights deeper and all-encompassing. they also have additional features related to savings or lowering the bills. I am completely satisfied and definitely will use it in the future.

I downloaded the app and tried to connect my account but it said it had a error and to try again in two hours. I didn‚Äôt think of it much at first so I waited a few hours and tried again. Same problem. I was slightly annoyed but I understand sometimes things like this happen. I submitted a request to support. Got a generic message saying please detail the issue. I replied back but still haven‚Äôt got an answer. I‚Äôve been trying every day now and it‚Äôs still giving me the same issue and still no answer from customer service. Not even someone messaging back saying ‚Äúwe are working on this‚Äù or ‚Äúsorry about that this connection going to be down for a while. We will let you know when it‚Äôs up and running‚Äù.

This app had great reviews when I originally looked to download the app but the more recent ones have been bad. 

Needless to say I‚Äôm going to delete the app before I even got to use it. üòî

column2: {'id': 35740377, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for the great review! We are glad to know that you and your family enjoy using our app and find it so helpful. If you have any questions or suggestions, please feel free to contact us at support@pocketguard.com. Have a wonderful day!', 'modified': '2023-04-03T12:00:23Z'}
column3:
I have used every budgeting and spending app offered since 2003.  By far, this is the most straightforward and user friendly app I‚Äôve used.  I hope it never goes away, I‚Äôve paid for the premium version to get the absolute most out of the app.  My 81 year old mother now uses the app, she also loves it.  

I reference the app multiple times a day, I can easily reference what bills are still outstanding without use of a calculator or downloading an excel file, although I can if needed.  I can easily show my husband our spending trends and cash flow.  I have gradually added more to the app and we are now tracking net worth.  It is a breeze.

column2:
{'id': 21236050, 'body': "Hi there! Thank you for your feedback. Your wife and you can share the same PocketGuard profile on different devices. In this case, you will have the shared In My Pocket. Since the In My Pocket calculation depends on the total monthly income that is different for you and your wife and pending transactions could be modified by the financial institution during the day, indeed, the amount might changes. Please, contact us at support@pocketguard.com, so we could specify how to use last month's leftover and handle periodic expenses.


", 'modified': '2021-02-23T10:52:47Z'}
column3:
This program is difficult to use. My wife and I both use it on our joint account, but our ‚Äúin my pocket‚Äù amount rarely matches. It jumps around wildly over the course of the day as well so we literally never know how much we have. It‚Äôs difficult to figure out how to handle things like using your bonus from last month since finances reset every month. It‚Äôs also difficult to figure out how to handle periodic expenses. 

Mint tells you how much you have left and how many days remain, so while it doesn‚Äôt give you a ‚Äúdaily number‚Äù you can easily divide cash remaining by days remaining. Mints balance matches for my wife and I and doesn‚Äôt have wild swings throughout the day. We feel much more confident using that program which just very simple math without any weird issues. It‚Äôs easy to see where money is and where it went.

I can not recommend this program.

column2: {'id': 25303645, 'body': "Hi there! Thanks for such an amazing review! Be assured that your request regarding color scheme customization has been heard. Our team will discuss it internally. Feel free to contact us at support@pocketguard.com if you have any other requests or questions. We're always ready to help!", 'modified': '2021-09-24T15:12:09Z'}
column3:
I‚Äôve used mint and every dollar. Every dollar is very clean looking, PocketGuard takes some getting used to. BUT, I‚Äôve got to tell you, after taking a few days or so to get my feet wet to truly understand this app and learn how to navigate my way through it, I love it! My favorite features:
‚Äì upcoming bills. It‚Äôs a feature that I have sorely been missing,Knowing what bills are coming up and when is key for making sure I‚Äôve got enough money in the bank to avoid overdraft payments. Super easy the way I have it set up, on the overview page I have a section that includes all my fixed costs for the month, easy to see and easy to categorize. Makes it super easy to budget what I have left over.
- hashtags.I love the hashtags, never been easier to see how much I spent on back to school stuff , on my recent vacation, etc.
-Love the easy comparison from one month to the next to see if I spent more than less than the previous month in a particular category.

There‚Äôs more, but suffice it to say that I found the app that works for me. 

My only qualm is that I wish you could customize the color scheme. I‚Äôd like a lighter color scheme.

column2: {'id': 30539774, 'body': 'Hi Vashion! Thanks for the amazing review! Our team is pleased to hear that the application fits your budgeting needs. Feel free to contact us at support@pocketguard.com if you have any questions/suggestions. Have a good day!\r\n\r\n', 'modified': '2022-06-24T13:16:22Z'}
column3: I kept talking about keeping a budget for years but kept making excuses. I originally installed mint, but as pleasing to the eye as it is, it is not as simple and intuitive as I'd like and months passed without recording anything. So when I decided to finally start, I deleted the app and looked again and this Budget Planner was my first choice. I was surprised by how quick and easy it is to use, intuitive, with a customizable yet simple interface, and mostly, informative. Easily budget customizing, custom finance categories implemented, subscription-manager, expense tracker, the app works like a switherland clock. Pocketguard is an extremely good budget planner for everyday

column2: {'id': 39824188, 'body': 'Hi there! Thank you for the fantastic review! We are glad that you enjoy using our app. Also, please rest assured that your feedback regarding the UI is heard, and we will discuss it internally. Have a nice day! ', 'modified': '2023-10-30T13:58:40Z'}
column3:
While I‚Äôve tried all other budget apps, this is by far the best out there. Very clean at reconciling and learning from past behaviors. I love that no matter what Harris Teeter grocery store I go to, it appears as Harris Teeter, not Harris Teeter store !785!, or whatever. The In My Pocket, which I wish they called, Left to Spend takes some time to learn, but it‚Äôs great once you do. 

Only ask is try update the UI. While I‚Äôm not a fan of Mint, it looks much more current like my bank app. If you could update the fonts, get rid of the grey and use white with dark screen at night, that would be great!

Otherwise keep up the other updates. Five stars!

Love the functionality of the app itself. I love that I can characterize my transactions and track how much I‚Äôm spending in each category while creating budgets for areas I want to cut down in. I also love that this provides you an ‚ÄúIn Pocket‚Äù number so I can be sure to not overspend by the end of the month. For reference I have the Pro version and it‚Äôs worth it! 

Edited: I used to have some issues with bank connectivity that caused my budgeting to be off by +\- $100 which was frustrating. However the PocketGuard team fixed the issue and I‚Äôm enjoying this app again with confidence my budgeting is accurate üôÇ
column7: App Itself Is Great, Bank Connectivity Could Be Improved

column2: {'id': 35199436, 'body': 'Hi Jazi! Thanks for the fantastic review! We are pleased that you found our budgeting features useful for your needs. Feel free to contact us at support@pocketguard.com if you have any questions/suggestions. Have a great day!', 'modified': '2023-03-04T11:02:19Z'}
column3: This app has been exactly what I‚Äôve been looking for when it comes to budgeting. I love that I can see my spending patterns on a monthly basis too. I did decide to purchase the lifetime option, and love that I can change transaction dates (especially for end of the month transactions) creating my own categories, and being able to split my transactions. It gives me a much more clear and accurate view of my spending. The hashtags has been great too so if I‚Äôm paying via credit card I can know what that specific I transaction was for. All in all, I love this app!

column2: {'id': 23562131, 'body': "Hi there! Thank you very much for your feedback. In case, there are transactions that haven't been cleared or missing, please send us a screenshot from your online banking displaying these transactions at support@pocketguard.com. Regarding pending transactions - sometimes they can be deleted or modified by the financial institution, so we'll not be able to match them with posted transactions. In this case, any edits you make to such pending transactions will be lost. This is why editing pending transactions is not allowed in PocketGuard. Feel free to contact us, so we could send the workaround. By the way, the idea to display income as a budget sounds very interesting! I have sent this to my team, so we could dig deeper into details. Thank you for sharing. Have a wonderful day!", 'modified': '2021-06-24T09:30:10Z'}
column3: It works really well. Occasionally he glitches but they seem very responsive about fixing it. Some banks transactions clear much much quicker than others. I wish the Pending transactions allowed you to go ahead and update the category as well as add hashtags. One of my banks takes several days for transactions to clear so I‚Äôm always a week behind on updating categories. The reports are great. As a former long time user of Quicken, I only hung on for the reports but I haven‚Äôt used it since I moved to PocketGuard. The one change I would make is to add income to the budget page so for those of us on variable incomes you have an better idea of if bills will be covered.

column2: {'id': 2486187, 'body': "We are sorry for all the troubles caused. The Internal server error has already been fixed, so you can sign in to the app with no problem now. As for the error on refreshing an account, we need to take a closer look at it to help you. Please contact us at support@pocketguard.com and we'll do our best to have the issue solved for you.", 'modified': '2018-02-03T13:46:38Z'}

Coming from Level App I have spent a long time testing out various finance apps that could replace it. 

PocketGuard is by far the best solution feature for feature however for whatever reasons my bank account needed to be reconnected but error‚Äôd our every time I tried to update. It also error‚Äôd out when I tried to delete the scout all together and re-ad. Finally I went to the website and update, which worked but error‚Äôd out on the app when I tried refreshing. 

As a last resort I deleted the app and reinstalled and now it errors out when I try to sign in! I don‚Äôt see a way to submit feedback via the support tool on the app so a review is the only place I can resort to. Please fix this so I can adjust my review appropriately! Thank you
column7: Continuous 500 errors renders the app useless

column2: {'id': 19046381, 'body': "Hi Jonathan! Thank you for your feedback. You can disable budget alerts and reminders to add expenses in your PocketGuard profile settings. In case, you'd like to disable notifications on your phone, you should turn them off in your phone settings. Would you mind emailing us at support@pocketguard.com, so we could dig deeper into the issue and send you detailed instructions on how you could do that?", 'modified': '2020-11-11T15:58:19Z'}
column3:
PocketGuard does what I need it to by bringing all my accounts into one place. The hashtag feature is great when I‚Äôm trying to track a specific thing that may be related to multiple budget categories like #VR stuff :)

The notifications are a hot mess though and there is very limited controls. Also, I‚Äôm paying for a subscription here, can you please disable the ad notifications for your find savings section? It‚Äôs not helpful and I get no value from it at this time. 

What I‚Äôd like to see is individual control to enable and disable notifications as needed for bill reminders, late bills, large deposits (payday), going over budgets, etc.
column7: Easy way to see past, present, and plan for the future

column2: {'id': 41305278, 'body': 'Hi there! We are so sorry for the inconvenience caused. We have already hired more support managers and promise to respond to everyone and provide refunds/cancellations. Once again, sorry for the inconvenience.', 'modified': '2024-01-15T19:50:37Z'}

Former Mint user here. Thought I would give PocketGuard a try and avoid monthly/yearly payments. Unfortunately, if you have a Fidelity Cash management account, your transactions do not counts towards any budget/spending analytics. So the app is almost useless to me and I spent $100 on a lifetime subscription.

Worst part is, I‚Äôve reached out to PocketGuard support several times and haven‚Äôt heard anything back for over a week. I‚Äôm incredibly disappointed, and wish I had known what I know now.

If they could fix this issue and/or actually respond to me, I would not have such bad things to say.
column7: Fidelity Customers: Do Not Use PocketGuard!

column2: {'id': 25119669, 'body': "Hi there! Thanks for the 5-star review! It's great to hear that you found our app useful. You can always contact us at support@pocketguard.com if you have any suggestions/concerns. Have a nice day!", 'modified': '2021-09-15T11:58:43Z'}
column3:
Highly recommend this app. It is amazing for keeping track of your money and how it‚Äôs spent. I liked it enough I took advantage of the 4th of July special for the upgraded version. 

I have multiple sclerosis and my cognitive functions are sometimes impacted, so being able to see and track everything in one app is a great tool.

I had connection issues for one of my accounts, emailed support when it didn‚Äôt correct after some time and the customer service took a day or so after my email (I think?)
column7: Quick and easy option to track finances

column3: App often disconnects from my account. Has never reflected any transactions made on my credit card, but displays the account balance. Customer service takes forever to resolve issues and money management has to go back to manual entry until they figure it out. Although accurately tracking and organizing transactions, the account balances once stopped updating completely, (which would seem to be an easy fix with the refresh button) but it doesn‚Äôt work. After giving it a few more days and a new update, the accounts reflected the proper amounts in my account. But now it closes within 5 seconds of me opening the app. Great idea but it just doesn‚Äôt seem this company has the system figured out yet, I will be heading to Mint when my subscription expires. Which, btw, they ignored my request to cancel multiple times.
