column2: {'id': 35741752, 'body': "Hi there! Thank you for the feedback. Be assured that your voice is heard, and we will have an internal discussion to find ways to improve the app in these matters. Regarding the case of your paycheck, please note that you can change the date of the paycheck transaction to include it in the next month's calculations.", 'modified': '2023-04-03T13:02:02Z'}
column3:
The ease of use and simplicity are impeccable. The app has great promise, but there are a few things that are not helpful: Account management- cannot clearly tell if you‚Äôre in the trial period or if you actually have the premium service. If you have the premium tier you can‚Äôt tell if you‚Äôre monthly or annual. 

Bill name- cannot update the merchant name. I had to delete the bill and re- add it because I had a misspelled word. 

Budget planning- my monthly paycheck comes at the end of the month and I use it to plan the next month. I can‚Äôt tell if the app recognizes that. It looks like it wants to count my March paycheck for March bills but the month is over. Thank you.
column7: Overall great app, a few snags that almost seem deceptive

column2: {'id': 27339409, 'body': 'Hi Jennifer! Thank you for rating our budget app! It would be helpful if you could share your insights about improving budgeting features and describe the problem with the web app at support@pocketguard.com. Have a nice day!', 'modified': '2022-01-10T08:27:20Z'}
column3: App is well designed and extremely helpful, though there‚Äôs room for improvement. A number of banks are not able to sync (Apple card, Ellevest) which causes for inaccurate info, the desktop application is exceptionally slow preforming, and there are a few features that could use tweaking (like the ability to recognize transactions and associate them using ‚Äòto‚Äô and ‚Äòfrom‚Äô). Still rating 5 star though, because it is the best money management app I‚Äôve ever used and I find it very user-friendly.

column2: {'id': 35236208, 'body': 'Hi there! Sorry for the inconvenience. Please contact us at support@pocketguard.com so our support team can get additional information about your issues and investigate them in detail. Hope for your understanding.', 'modified': '2023-03-06T17:07:29Z'}
column3:
This app is a really cool idea and if it worked well I‚Äôd continue my paid subscription. However, there are a couple big issues: 
- It‚Äôs really slow - almost unusable. This seems newer. When I first started using it it wasn‚Äôt this slow. Just scrolling through transactions is so tedious because it freezes and then scrolls way further than you want 
- It doesn‚Äôt always catch when your accounts are out out of date or not updating. For example, I have one account that just won‚Äôt seem to update any transactions from the last 6 months but PocketGuard isn‚Äôt showing any errors with the connection. This type of ‚Äòsilent‚Äô failure to update really takes away from the value  because I can‚Äôt trust what I see in the app.
-There also seems to be pretty frequent errors with accounts where I have to remove and re-add them or re-enter credentials. This is probably more related to the external accounts and their security but it‚Äôs still annoying. 

All in all, I find myself using the actual bank apps more than PocketGuard due to these issues even though I‚Äôd prefer to have it all in one place and use PocketGuard.
column7: The bugs, slowness, and lack of reliability aren‚Äôt worth it

column2: {'id': 29595991, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for your feedback. It‚Äôs great to hear that PocketGuard helps you stay on track and control your money. We have already started working on pending transaction handling, so you‚Äôd be able to edit them and match them with the posted transactions. Besides that, please contact us at support@pocketguard.com, so we could investigate the issues and troubleshoot. Have a wonderful day!', 'modified': '2022-05-06T12:21:28Z'}
column3:
I love using PocketGuard for tracking my day to day spending and making sure I have enough to cover my bills. It‚Äôs fairly intuitive and is better for day to day tracking than things like personal capital. 

However, there are a couple things that don‚Äôt work quite right or as expected. 

Firstly, pending transaction are taken out of your ‚Äúpocket‚Äù but can‚Äôt be modified or attributed to bills. It can take quite a while for some transactions to be marked as cleared, which means that often times my ‚Äúpocket‚Äù is wildly inaccurate, since it‚Äôs counting large bills like my rent effectively twice. That kind of defeats the purpose of the tool. 

Secondly (and this may have more to do with the financial institution), but there are certain accounts that are listed as addable, but simple aren‚Äôt. My savings account, for example, hasn‚Äôt been able to sync for 6 months and the error is just a vague ‚Äúsomething went wrong.‚Äù Mind you it syncs fine on other budgeting apps. So that‚Äôs disappointing.
column7: Great, but has a few issues

column2: {'id': 38711123, 'body': 'Hi there! We are sorry for the inconvenience. It seems that during the processing of your second payment, we encountered an error, which resulted in your subscription status being changed to inactive. This problem can be fixed on your side by clicking on the "Restore Purchase" button. If you cannot find this button or would like to get a refund, please contact our support team at support@pocketguard.com. Hope for your understanding.', 'modified': '2023-09-04T12:49:26Z'}
column3: I signed up for the plus membership so you have to pay the 9.99/month. After the first month they reset all the in-app features to basic subscription. Despite continuing to pay for the plus membership I was promted in the app to subscribe to the plus membership when I opened the app. I was also not given access to the premium features and a message would pop up saying I needed the plus membership to use those features. Definitely will NOT be recommending this app. It‚Äôs a scam.

column2: {'id': 42988177, 'body': 'Hi there! We are always looking to improve the experience of our users and really appreciate your review. The development team has received your feedback and will discuss it internally. Have a great day!', 'modified': '2024-04-02T08:48:02Z'}
column3:
My biggest problem with Pocket guard is that when I go to check my accounts, I can‚Äôt view them all on one page, I have to scroll down to see them all so I end up writing them down on paper which kinda negates the advantage of having them listed on an app. 
    Secondly, I can‚Äôt check my latest transactions in each account. The transactions are listed but it is not easy to see which account they were made from or what category they might belong to. 
    Thirdly, I find it would be more helpful to have my accounts listed in ranked order from greatest to least.
     Fourth, the option to log out should be on the main screen, or at least at the top of the drop down menu. 
     I miss Mint.

I am loving this app and I have tried several. All of my banks and credit cards link up to the app without any errors and the interface is very user-friendly. I was already planning to keep the app because of how easy it makes it for me to analyze my spending, but then I got an email from warning me I only had two days left on my free trial and warning me to cancel before I get charged I don‚Äôt love the app. That is proof right there of how confident PocketGuard is that they have a quality app, and they are right! Great app, download it for yourself!

column2: {'id': 41809208, 'body': 'Hi there! You can turn off the pop-up from your Settings > Notifications. Also, you can filter your transactions and upload a CSV file that includes only monthly transactions. I will pass your feedback to my team. Feel free to contact us at support@pocketguard.com, in case of any concerns or suggestions.', 'modified': '2024-02-07T08:30:13Z'}
column3: I‚Äôm still getting used to this program. I‚Äôm not retirement age yet but have no debt so I wish I could hide the debt pay off section since it is irrelevant to me.  Also, I wish I could export monthly transactions instead of the over 20,000 I imported from Mint. Have a date range to export would be helpful.  I need to stop the pop-up asking for cash expenses, I use credit cards almost exclusively since I am a point collector through various credit cards. I see the point but again irrelevant to me. It would be nice if I could track my points and miles since the points at least have a cash value.

Overall this app is the best I have found to budget and monitor spending in one account. Unlike others it does a really great job tagging things to the appropriate category, and even when it doesn‚Äôt it‚Äôs easy to fix. I love the spending limits feature but **wish there was a weekly option as well!** When you get paid bi-weekly monthly budgets are very difficult to plan because paychecks never hit on the same dates. The ability to monitor weekly spending and stay in my budgeting limits would be a game changer and I would definitely pay for a pro account if that was an option.
column7: Excellent app for budgeting - needs weekly budget option

column3:
Biggest complaint is the frustratingly long time it takes to update your accounts. It takes days for it to reflect past transactions whether they‚Äôre income or expenses. 

The app itself offers plenty of features but it‚Äôs not very user friendly. Adding some tutorials would be nice. Getting rid of the Find Savings tab would be nice as well. Overall this app just throws a lot of information at you and doesn‚Äôt really show you how any of it is connected very well for you to actually manage your budget properly. You‚Äôll find yourself trying to go back and forth between tabs and various options just to do a simple task.

There are a few things I wish this app would do- like I want to apply just more than one goal in savings for my one savings account (ie: I‚Äôm using it to save an emergency fund AND a vacation- why can‚Äôt I split my amounts and track them?)

There are some features that it‚Äôs says are ‚Äúcoming‚Äù but not available yet... like if I make an extra payment toward my personal loan, I‚Äôll be able to apply which account I drew from to pay it (and not just ‚Äúcash‚Äù). It‚Äôll be a lot more helpful when these features are added.

But I‚Äôm mainly happy it actually connects to all of my accounts. Other apps like YNAB don‚Äôt work with a lot of banking companies.

column2: {'id': 41151533, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for the review! We are glad to hear that you enjoy using our budgeting features. Have a nice day!', 'modified': '2024-01-08T15:00:00Z'}
column3: This app has an In Your Pocket feature that is EXACTLY what I want from a budgeting app. You put in your income and expenses (with plenty of options to reflect the different types of both), and then you get to see what‚Äôs left ‚Äúin your pocket.‚Äù If you want to know how much money you have to spend on ancillary purchases, that‚Äôs what this tells you. It‚Äôs the perfect thing to help you determine if a current purchase‚Äîfor which an entire budget category doesn‚Äôt make sense‚Äîis reasonable or not. I highly recommend this app!

column2: {'id': 41439657, 'body': 'Hi there! Sorry for the inconvenience. Please contact us at support@pocketguard.com, so we can investigate your case and report this issue to our data provider. Have a great day!', 'modified': '2024-01-22T08:07:44Z'}
column3:
I‚Äôm currently trialing a few finance/budgeting apps, and so far Pocket Guard is pretty good. It‚Äôs features and functions are easy and allows for a satisfying amount of customization (though I could use even more).

Where it is falling very short for me is the inability to link my AmEx High Yield Savings Accounts. The bulk of my cash are in these accounts making it tough to reap the full benefit of the app. Other apps seem to have this same issue, which is odd given I had no issue linking my AmEx credit card. 

If I didn‚Äôt bank with AmEx, PG would be would be a no brainer for me to continue on with.
column7: Cannot link AmEx High Yield Savings Accounts

column3: Heard about this from my SO, it‚Äôs easy to use & free. The only reason I gave 4 stars was bc I couldn‚Äôt add store credit cards onto my Pocket guard account (an error popped up). Also, I had a spending goal but under goals, I wasn‚Äôt able to write that down (ex: I want to spend $100 on groceries each week). This isn‚Äôt too much of a problem for me, bc I can keep track of this myself. I just wish I could add my store credit cards. Also, my SO said he couldn‚Äôt add his Apple Card so I guess store credit cards not connected to major banks don‚Äôt work. However I still think it‚Äôs a good app and user friendly.
column7: Simple & easy but doesn‚Äôt have all store credit cards

column2: {'id': 29574672, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for the review! Our team is glad to hear that the app fits your tracking purposes. Be assured that your request is heard, and we will discuss internally whether we can modify the app in this matter. Have a nice day!', 'modified': '2022-05-05T12:34:27Z'}
column3:
I really like this app. It has really helped us see where our money is going.  
I do wish their was an option to turn off auto categorizing of transactions. I find myself searching all transactions for errors almost daily. If i could turn it off I could rest comfortably knowing they we‚Äôre always correct. 
For example, we sometimes buy gas at a location and sometimes we just stop in for a drink. The app puts this stores purchases in one category always. 
Not a big problem, can just be time consuming. 
The app is completely worth it regardless.

column2: {'id': 42884421, 'body': 'Hi there! Sorry for the inconvenience. Unfortunately, we\'ve experienced a huge impact on our support team due to the Mint shutdown. If you activated your free trial on iOS - you can go to Settings > iTunes & App Store > Apple ID > Subscriptions > Cancel. If you activated the free trial on our web app - go to the "Settings" tab > Customer portal > Cancel plan.\n\nPlease contact me directly at ivan@pocketguard.com, so I can answer your support cases and refund your subscription. Hope for your understanding!', 'modified': '2024-03-28T08:52:43Z'}
column3: Literally spend FOREVER, sent three emails and deleted several points of detailed data in order to cancel this free trial before I was charged and YOU CANT! It‚Äôs a scam. Period. They claimed I needed to delete the subscription from apple (purchase on the App Store) but the only thing purchased through app was the FREE trial. They charged the subscription on my card. Nothing listed as even possible to refund because nothing was purchased through apple. Deleted EVERYTHING from the app, followed all the cancelation instructions and email THREE TIMES to insure I was all set. Silence.  Listen, this is a scam.
column7: Free trial is a SCAM - you can‚Äôt cancel

column3: From what I can tell, this is the only app out there that is designed around the exact way I like to budget. It takes the month‚Äôs income and subtracts all your bills, subscriptions, recurring payments, things like that. So the money you have left over is what‚Äôs available to spend on food, gas, incidentals, fun stuff, etc, and the app keeps track of this number for you so you don‚Äôt have to worry about keeping track of it on your own. It‚Äôs exactly what I needed to help me stop unintentionally overspending! Very glad to have found this app. Thanks!

column2: {'id': 16536106, 'body': 'Hey guys! Sorry for the inconvenience. The problem with missing transactions is a known issue at the end of our data aggregation provider (Finicity). We‚Äôre working diligently to have it resolved as soon as possible and let you know once we hear any updates on this matter. Regarding the issue with "Sallie Mae": please, contact us at support@pocketguard.com, so we could file this case with our data aggregation provider. Hope for your understanding!', 'modified': '2020-07-10T13:56:12Z'}
column3:
Pros: 
-graphs and pie charts showing spending, income , and what was spent on
-easy to set up 
-dark mode with cool colors
- let‚Äôs me adjust dates on transactions which is nice because my paycheck for a month sometimes comes in the next month which can mess up my data
- auto savings as well as auto saving from each pay check 
- a lot of categories to choose from for transactions 
- merchant history which allows you to see past monthly spending on one category
Other things these are the best for me

CONS: 
- I don‚Äôt know why some transactions aren‚Äôt showing up and it really screws with my income vs spending graphs 
-can never connect to Sallie Mae 
- auto save isn‚Äôt consistent at taking out money as indicated

Overall I love this app and for the past 2 months I‚Äôve  run into the problems stated in cons. I don‚Äôt know why it‚Äôs happening I contacted support and they‚Äôre taking a while to get back to me. If these things could be fixed this app is the best among the others in my opinion. But these flaws are defeating the purpose for why I even use it :/

It's hard to believe, but I've already saved a lot of money thanks to this app. It was a little difficult to follow my savings goal at first, so my advise is to start from the small amount and then go step by step to the bigger one. Don't forget to set up your spending limits as they will help you not to overspend and again, achieve the goal. The other advice is to make sure you've set up your recurring transactions properly and all the transfers were matched. And check the faq as it was pretty helpful when I've just started.

I would highly recommend this tool to everyone who has decided to change the way of spending. This app won't tell you where to spend and where don't, but it will show you what happens if you do this. Overspent this week? Try to cut the spending on everything you can in order to stay on track this month. Failed this month? Go and increase budgets for each category. Everything is pretty simple but you may need to have a good planning in the beginning and at the end of the month.

column2: {'id': 35057381, 'body': 'Hi there! Unfortunately, we cannot investigate such issues without additional information from your side. Please provide our support team with details so they can dig deeper into the problem. Hope for your understanding.', 'modified': '2023-02-24T14:53:16Z'}
column3:
This app has potential but it‚Äôs so flawed at this point that it‚Äôs virtually useless.  Many many transactions are duplicates so your budget updates are always wrong.  Some transactions are repeated two and three times.  I written to the support email several times but I always get the same bot response.  These developers have a good idea but a terrible execution.

Which is too bad.  I really wanted a portable budget app that gave me ACCURATE updates on my spending.  This app does the very opposite.

column2: {'id': 41151715, 'body': 'Hi there! Thank you for the feedback! Please contact our support team at support@pocketguard.com so we can get more information about the features you are missing in the app. Hope for your understanding and have a good day!', 'modified': '2024-01-08T15:09:14Z'}
column3: I came over from Rocket Money because many of my accounts were not able to connect to Rocket Money. The good news is that all of my accounts connect to Pocket Guard. The not so good news is how Pocket Guard shows monthly budgets. I‚Äôm currently renovating my house and I‚Äôve been transferring and spending savings. Pocket Guard doesn‚Äôt have the level of automation that Rocket Money does and so it is treating transfers and withdrawals as expenses effectively double counting.  Rocket Money does this for you, which is a time saver. I hope pocket guard enhances expense categorization. I paid for a lifetime membership and I‚Äôm starting to regret it.
column7: Was hoping this my last budgeting app

column2: {'id': 32835587, 'body': 'Hi there! Sorry for the inconvenience. According to the errors you‚Äôve mentioned, the issue has happened on the end of our data aggregation provider - Finicity.com. Please contact us at support@pocketguard.com, so we could get all the required information to file your case for troubleshooting. Hope for your understanding.', 'modified': '2022-10-28T08:07:32Z'}
column3: I paid for plus to be able to access the debt payoff plan. I‚Äôve added a few accounts, but am no longer able to add credit cards or loans. The whole point of the payoff plan is to help me understand the order in which to payoff debts by using snowball or avalanche method through the app. I‚Äôm not able to get the full picture since I cannot add all my accounts to compare APRs and balances. Continually getting error codes 170, 940, and ‚Äúcontact your administrator if error continues‚Äù errors.

I would highly recommend this tool to everyone who has decided to change the way of spending. This app won't tell you where to spend and where don't, but it will show you what happens if you do this. Overspent this week? Try to cut the spending on everything you can in order to stay on track this month. Failed this month? Go and increase budgets for each category. Everything is pretty simple but you may need to have a good planning in the beginning and at the end of the month.

You‚Äôre forced to connect a bank or billing account right after signup and aren‚Äôt given the option to delete your newly created profile if you‚Äôre not comfortable with that. You can only sign out, but there‚Äôs no way to bypass the bank account connection screen.

This is either UX in need of refinement or an oversight by the product team. This feedback is coming from a product manager working in tech:

Refine your workflow because you‚Äôve completely missed a key use case and have created a dead-end scenario between sign up and account connection. As an app based in the finance space, you cannot afford to forego user trust. It‚Äôs too expensive.

‚ÄúAs a user, I want to delete my newly registered account, because I‚Äôve decided that I‚Äôm not comfortable connecting a back account.‚Äù
column7: Poor UX: Cannot Delete Account Between Sign Up and Account Connection

column2: {'id': 11902374, 'body': 'Hi Joey! We have a Referral Program, so you can apply for Plus for free: https://help.pocketguard.com/hc/en-us/articles/360002196519-PocketGuard-referral-program-or-how-to-get-Plus-for-free-. Also, if this is not a feature you are ready to pay for, I would appreciate if you contact us at support@pocketguard.com and tell us about the features that worth your money. ', 'modified': '2019-11-18T09:25:54Z'}
column3:
In order to add a one time payment (common for people who get different amounts with every check, that is, those with part-time or service jobs with inconsistent and unpredictable hours) you have to pay for the PLUS version of this app. 

Pocketguard has failed its mission in that it does not help the working people who are strapped for cash and in most need of a simple budgeting app. In other words, if you are struggling with financial instability, pocketguard wants you to pay THEM for it. Way to go
column7: Can only do repeat paycheck amount

column2: {'id': 43671211, 'body': 'Hi there! We are glad that you are enjoying using our app. Have a nice day!', 'modified': '2024-05-03T09:00:09Z'}
column3: PocketGuard has been a really helpful tool in understanding our family expenses. Early on I had trouble syncing to my smaller credit union and PocketGuard worked on the issue over a couple weeks until it was resolved. Syncing is smooth now and the categories and tracking are easy or manage. I purchased the full plan a year or so ago and and glad I did. The extra functionality has been well worth it.
column7: So many functions and great support

column2: {'id': 42989559, 'body': 'Hi there! We are so sorry for the inconvenience caused. Unfortunately, the unexpected Mint closure hit our support team so much. As a result, we are unable to provide quick replies to all support inquiries. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôve decided to focus on our customer service automatization first and then continue delivering all the promised functionality, such as Rollover Budgets, Transaction Rules, etc. Hope for your understanding!', 'modified': '2024-04-02T09:22:18Z'}
column3: This app promised several updates that kept getting pushed back. I was very patient in waiting for them to provide the updates they promised. However, when I finally reached out after months of waiting, I was told they still were unsure of the expected updates. I asked for a refund and they were unable to process it. I was told to go through Apple. However, Apple said that I waited too long and they were no longer able to refund me for the subscription. Long story short: don‚Äôt believe PocketGuard when they say they are going to make updates. And don‚Äôt wait too long for them to make these updates before you request a refund!

column2: {'id': 20884793, 'body': 'Hi Bobby! Sorry for the inconvenience. Please, email us at support@pocketguard.com, so we could investigate the root cause of the issue and troubleshoot as soon as possible. Hope for your understanding.\n', 'modified': '2021-02-05T15:50:12Z'}
column3:
Once you link your accounts, you will frequently experience emails from PocketGuard with ‚ÄúHouston, we have a problem‚Äù that states one of your accounts has been disconnected. If you‚Äôre lucky you can reconnect it, but chances are you‚Äôll keep getting an error. There are some accounts, like my retirement, that won‚Äôt even connect for a first time. It‚Äôll tell you wrong credentials, even though I‚Äôm literally copy and pasting them from the account settings of that bank. If I can‚Äôt connect my accounts or if they won‚Äôt stay connected then I consider it unusable.
Definitely not worth the paid version, at least. 

It‚Äôs a bummer because the analytics and budgeting features are easy to use and understand. Oh well, onwards.

column2: {'id': 19440369, 'body': 'Hi there! Thank you for your feedback. Indeed, you can set up a recurring bill every 2 months in the app, however, if you need to change the next bill due date, you should go to the bill details and select the correct due date manually. Regarding transactions, please send us a screenshot from your online banking displaying missing transactions at support@pocketguard.com and specify the name of the financial institution, so we could dig deeper into the issue and resolve it as soon as possible. Hope for your understanding.', 'modified': '2020-11-30T14:33:00Z'}
column3: This app is ok so far but it needs some work. Please add a feature where we can add a due date for things that are billed every 2 months. For example, I have a bill for renters insurance that is billed every 2 months. The app has the option for me to select it but when I tried to put the next bill due date in the app, it won‚Äôt let me select the date that is 2 months from now. Please fix it. Also transactions don‚Äôt always show up although the banking info is correct. Once the app is more user friendly I‚Äôll update my rating.

column2: {'id': 36050788, 'body': 'Hi there! Please note that calculations in our app are based on your income, not on account balances. You can contact our support team at support@pocketguard.com, and they will help you resolve any setup issues. We hope for your understanding, have a nice day!', 'modified': '2023-04-19T12:20:01Z'}
column3:
I‚Äôve Ben trying to set up my budget for the past hour. It‚Äôs literally impossible. Despite having plenty of money in my accounts this stupid app thinks I‚Äôm -2,000 in my accounts. 

Why does it think I will buy $1,000 worth of plane tickets every month just because i recently bought a plane ticket???

Why did it assume that cash i till out of an atn is a ‚Äòrecurring bill‚Äô??

The first time user experience is absolutely horrible. I was really exciting about automating my budgeting that I‚Äôve been doing manually with another app; but this is impossible to set up!

This app needs a consultant to help the developers make it more ‚Äòidiot proof‚Äô because I‚Äôm so frustrated I‚Äôm about to give up and just delete it after less than an hour.
column7: Way too hard to set up

column3: I was very excited when I'd started to use PocketGuard and now I'm really excited about my achievements. It's been a year and I was able to save up enough money for buying a new car. It was pretty important as I use it for my job and family needs equally. Hard to imagine that you can set aside some small amounts of money and then buy a new car, but when you stop making impulse purchases in almost every category, you will definitely see the prospects.

When you are single, budgeting doesn't seem as somthing must-have. However now as a married man with a toddler I know that it's crucial for my family to have not only a decent amount during the whole month, but also have a safety net fund. Pocket Guard was the app that helped me to start budgeting and change my spending habits. Besides, it's awesome that the app categories my purchases and it only takes me minutes to check what I am spending on this month.

column2: {'id': 41404334, 'body': "Hi there! Please note that you can start a 7-day free trial and if you won't like it, you can simply cancel from your device settings. After that, your PocketGuard profile will switch to the free basic version and you will be able to purchase a one-time lifetime option. Our team would appreciate your valuable feedback based on the updated budgeting experience within the app.", 'modified': '2024-01-19T17:16:22Z'}
column3:
I downloaded the app hoping to just pay a one time fee with no subscription. As it is advertised in their app page. 

Web search‚Äôs turn up that they‚Äôre doing A/B price testing and playing around with subscriptions and pricing models. I‚Äôm good off that. I‚Äôll be going back to the old ways of tracking my budget until I can find a simple one time fee that doesn‚Äôt require subscription and milk my budget for more money. The irony in the sales tactic is thick. 

Now I‚Äôm just disappointed that I gave all my financial information to some organization that doesn‚Äôt have my best interests to begin with.
column7: Not even 5 hours in and I‚Äôm out.

column3: Unfortunately, this App has a fatal flaw that limits its use. The app inputs data from your credit card and you subsequently categorize your purchases into budgets. What this app fails to do it save your categories. Credit card companies frequently update and when this happens you lose all of your information. Months of work categorizing your purchases is lost. Therefore, this app doesn‚Äôt work! I even purchased the full subscription.

column2: {'id': 42658157, 'body': 'Hi there. We are sorry for the inconvenience. Please contact me directly at ivan@pocketguard.com so I can review your issues in detail. Hope for your understanding!', 'modified': '2024-03-18T11:58:10Z'}
column3:
I have an American Express card and recently it‚Äôs started to disconnect from pocket guard and is the biggest hassle to log back into. 

I also noticed that at least once a week my transactions are moved out of the ‚ÄúBudgets‚Äù I assigned them to previously, so I have to go back and do it again. It‚Äôs a good concept of an app but there are many bugs that make it frustrating. 

I‚Äôd also like the ability to see from month to month where I‚Äôm at versus just one single month‚Ä¶ rename certain transactions differently.. several things like that that just don‚Äôt have the customization.
column7: Just ok.. lots of syncing errors

column3:
I really like the user interface and tools within the app.

The only reason u give it 4 stars not 5 is that, I cannot log on to multiple devices at one time, nor can I share my budget.  My spouse and I use this together and it would make things so much easier if we were able to share it that way.

When I tried using the ‚Äúshare‚Äù option in the app, it just send a link for them to create their own individual budget/profile
column7: Love it for the most part.

column3: I have been looking for a budget, income and spending app. Tried Mint ! Did not like it. Tried EveryDollar. It was a disaster. Crashed many times. Disconnected from the bank. Customer service was a pain in the neck. And when you connect it all the transactions you have to enter again. Gave up on that pricey deal. Finally I found this one. Great look. User friendly. Only one suggestion:  How can I enter cash expenses? Or am I missing anything ? To make the story short: I LOVE IT SO FAR.

column2: {'id': 33456199, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for your feedback. PocketGuard doesn‚Äôt let to set unachievable goals. That means if you don‚Äôt have enough money in your In My Pocket to contribute minimum contributions on a monthly basis, then you should adjust your budget or start next month. Another way is to set a minimum amount for this month and edit your goal for the next month. Please contact us at support@pocketguard.com, so we could review your case and send the instructions. Hope for your understanding.', 'modified': '2022-11-30T15:23:35Z'}
column3: Every day when I open the app I have to manually remind the app to refresh my bank account data to the current day. It used to automatically update around 5am daily. Also, it‚Äôs taking longer and longer (upwards of 3-5 minutes) for the data from the bank to cross over to the app. This used to happen within a few seconds. I have downloaded the most current version with the same issue.
column7: App not updating account info automatically

column2: {'id': 41834629, 'body': 'Hi there! Sorry for the inconvenience. Our team is experiencing a huge impact of support inquiries due to the Mint shutdown. Please contact me at oleksandr@pocketguard.com, so I can analyze your case and send detailed steps how to troubleshoot. Hope for your understanding.', 'modified': '2024-02-08T08:49:37Z'}
column3: It‚Äôs a great looking UI, and seems like great features. The problem is it just won‚Äôt register one of my regular paychecks I get monthly from the link with my bank. It gets one but not the second check. Because it looks like I‚Äôm over budget since it can‚Äôt see my full income it won‚Äôt let me make a budget or any goals. I‚Äôve submitted questions through the help messaging and emailed and no one responds. I‚Äôve had it for a couple months now hoping it would catch up but no such luck. So I‚Äôm not going to pay for anymore months on an app I can‚Äôt use. Good luck to others!

column2: {'id': 41152056, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for your feedback! Please contact us at support@pocketguard.com so we can get additional information about the issue with your location. Hope for your understanding and have a great day!', 'modified': '2024-01-08T15:22:47Z'}
column3: I‚Äôm glad pocketguard has the best U.S bank connectivity out of all the budgeting apps I‚Äôve used. I also love how the UI/UX is modern and minimalist. Problem is that I can‚Äôt access Pocketguard while traveling for business in Asia. And thing is I travel a lot. The only way to use Pocketguard is to turn on a VPN and then manually refresh my bank accounts to get the latest data which is a big inconvenience and that‚Äôs what stops me from paying extra. Other budgeting apps don‚Äôt have this problem
column7: Bank connectivity is great, managing while overseas? Not so much

column3: It was my New Year resolution to start getting out of credit card debt and to improve my financial health. I installed this app as believed that it would help me to reach the goal and it really does. I've been using it only for 2 months so far but it already works great for me. I found out where I can save and set some spending limits for the categories of spendings. Besides, BillShark negotiated with my Interent and TV providers and they reduced my bills! So I am totally satisfied with Pocketguard¬†

column2: {'id': 47389133, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for bringing this to our attention! We are constantly working to enhance the app's performance for a smoother user experience. Your feedback helps us improve, and we'd love to offer more direct support. Please email us at support@pocketguard.com so we can gather more details about this issue with stability and walk you through any confusing features. Update alert: The freezing issue has been fixed. Please update the app to the latest version to access the improvements. We want to make sure the app is convenient and reliable for you!\r", 'modified': '2024-10-11T17:27:54Z'}
column3: The app shows net worth per month as bar plot, which is terrible and calculation is incorrect. All apps I used or tried before show net worth as line or area chart, which is more appropriate. Also the app freezes most of the time while loading new transactions and I have to close the app and re-open it again. Some of its features like ‚ÄúPlan‚Äù are useless because it‚Äôs so confusing to use.

column2: {'id': 34014522, 'body': 'Hi there! Sorry for the inconvenience. This issue should be reported to our data aggregation provider. Please, contact us at support@pocketguard.com so our support team can get the additional information and forward this case to the engineering team for troubleshooting. Hope for your understanding.', 'modified': '2022-12-30T15:51:57Z'}
column3: Tried linking my credit union. Got a text with verification number. App tries to connect with my correct log in but fails. App fails to allow user to enter verification text info as a scree never asks. App fails to allow user to connect credit union‚Ä¶tries to connect then fails. Look around, there are apps that are much more ‚Äúuser-friendly‚Äù and work.

column2: {'id': 47625521, 'body': "Hello, thank you for your comment. We apologize for any confusion regarding your subscription. Please review the article about refund requests for App Store purchases and follow its steps to submit a request: https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT204084.\nWe're happy to help with any app-related questions and would love to welcome you back by offering a 30-day free period if you decide to give us another try!", 'modified': '2024-10-22T11:31:38Z'}
column3: I forgot to cancel on the 14th day. I actually was going to continue with using the app but on a month to month basis. Once I realize I forgot to cancel I tried to get a refund. I have been denied on all fronts. I feel scammed now I do not want to even use the app anymore. Do not sign up for the free trial, they will not give your money back.

column2: {'id': 41857055, 'body': 'Hi there! Sorry for the inconvenience. We have had a huge impact on our support team due to the Mint shutdown. Please contact me at oleksandr@pocketguard.com, so I can send you the instructions on how to get a refund an troubleshoot other cases.', 'modified': '2024-02-09T11:48:24Z'}
column3: They will charge you and you have no recourse. Their support email addresses are literally fake and undeliverable. When we tried to cancel our subscription there is literally nobody to talk to or email or get a hold of. Along with that the app doesn‚Äôt even function properly or have a computer interface.

column2: {'id': 41151651, 'body': 'Hi Jim! Thank you for the review! We are glad that the app meets your needs. Rest assured that your feedback is heard and we will discuss ways to improve the home page of the app. Have a great day!', 'modified': '2024-01-08T15:06:16Z'}
column3: I love the app and it has all the features I was looking for in a budgeting app after switching from Mint. Only thing that would make it perfect is a bit more variety and content in the home page widgets. There is only one option which is not the best one for seeing all the information from my home screen as there are no numbers.
column7: Great app, complete and easy to use!

column2: {'id': 1868901, 'body': 'We are very sorry for the inconveniences. Could you please contact us at support@pocketguard.com so that we could investigate and fix the issue for you and make the app cool again :-) Looking forward to hearing from you!', 'modified': '2017-11-28T14:52:02Z'}
column3:
Old: After a whole day of not syncing my PayPal transactions I removed the account and added it again, after about the 10th image captcha I gave up. This app seemed pretty cool at first but is just a waste of time really.

New: I really do like this app but find myself having to reconnect all my accounts daily or every other day. I found out they have a web beta of Pocket Guard and I‚Äôd sign into that and refresh my account and usually everything updated right away but when I did it today still shows old transactions and nothing has updated.

The tools are here. The sync works. The concept works. The program that tries to give names to your transactions is just terrible. I come back to this app about every 6-12 months to see if it‚Äôs been scrapped but it‚Äôs still chugging along misidentifying transactions. Heaven help you if there‚Äôs 2 or more bills from a similar lender if you want them classified differently, or if a utility decides to have a new accounting firm processing charges that changes the name. Then they blamed me for the mess that their software created. If it would just let me give out unique names if and when warranted then I wouldn‚Äôt have an issue.

column2: {'id': 28702287, 'body': "Hi Carey! The mentioned error means that your password doesn't meet the security measures. Please, contact us at support@pocketguard.com, so we could send your an instruction on how to set your password correctly. Hope for your understanding.\n", 'modified': '2022-03-21T19:11:03Z'}
column3: I was really excited to start using the app. I go in to create an account and the only two options are to use google or apple to sign in. Both times it responded with error insecure password. It would be fine if I could just make an account through the app. Very frustrating.

column2: {'id': 40823434, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for your feedback. We understand your security concerns and have recently added an alternative way to send information to the support team - through our application. This method is completely secure, so you can use it to send additional information/questions. As for the additional information, it is required by our data provider for troubleshooting purposes, and unfortunately, our support team cannot start an investigation without it. Please feel free to hide any sensitive data you are uncomfortable sharing. We hope for your understanding.', 'modified': '2023-12-21T11:30:12Z'}
column3:
I really want to like this app. In fact, I would sign up for the lifetime membership except for one issue where only a subset of my accounts in one bank show up. 

I asked support for help and they will not get on the phone with me. Rather, they want me to email them bank account information. This is insane - if they are ok with sensitive information being shared by email, what else are they doing with my account information?  My bank literally warns me every month that I should never share by email the information that support is asking.
column7: Insisting on having me send sensitive account data over insecure email

column3:
The app and website are great. We need an iPad app though.

It would also be helpful if you could plug-in your fixed and variable expenses for each month, organized in the order you want, and then have the amounts updated based on the actual expense each month; and, then have the expense change colors once it has been paid. For those of us who were tracking our personal income statements on spreadsheets.

column2: {'id': 41305289, 'body': 'Hi there! We are so sorry for the inconvenience caused. Right now, we are experiencing a huge impact on our support system due to an increase in support tickets since Mint announced its shutdown. We work diligently to reply to everyone and provide a 100% refund and free months of PocketGuard Plus as an apology. We have already hired more support managers and promise to respond to everyone and provide refunds/cancellations. Once again, sorry for the inconvenience.', 'modified': '2024-01-15T19:51:49Z'}
column3: Several days before the free trial ended, I sent 3 emails to cancel my subscription and yet got charged for the life time subscription. They are so hard to reach and have terrible customer support and make it very difficult to cancel once you give them your credit card information.

I've been using Pocket Guard as a Basic user for a while and was happy about it but have to tell you that being a Plus user is much better for me. Additional categories are a great help for analyzing my spendings and tracking cash made my budget really accurate. Now I manage to save up to 300 bucks per months compared to 100 on Basic plan. Hope you'll be adding some more features to the premium plan.

column2: {'id': 31617908, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for the wonderful feedback. We are excited to hear that our budgeting features fit your needs and help you stay on track. Feel free to contact us at support@pocketguard.com if you have any questions/suggestions about the app. Have a great day!', 'modified': '2022-08-23T11:00:51Z'}
column3: Tried using mint but it would never sync quickly with my bank and the layout wasn‚Äôt very intuitive.  Been using PocketGuard for about a month now and absolutely love it. It syncs with all my accounts super quickly and has a ton of customization options for your budget that make it super easy to track any sort of spending.

column2:
{'id': 45816503, 'body': "Hi there,

We're sorry to hear about the difficulties you've had with our customer support.

We apologize for any inconvenience this has caused you. Please contact me directly at ivan@pocketguard.com, and I will personally ensure your issue is addressed as quickly as possible.

Thank you for your understanding.", 'modified': '2024-08-07T09:15:22Z'}
column3: I really like this app, however, getting any assistance from customer support seems almost impossible. After telling it to not use one of our accounts and to ignore it, it continued to use items from that account in our budget and planning. I contacted support for help, and after a week of still not hearing anything I guess I will cancel my subscription and remove the app from my phone and go to another app.
column7: A lot of promise, but cannot get help with the most basic items

column2: {'id': 22143872, 'body': "Hi there! Sorry for the inconvenience. Please, verify that you don't have 2 accounts with the same transactions linked to the app. If so, hide one of the accounts. After that, please sign out of the app and then sign back in. If the issue still persists, please specify the name of the financial institution and the account name with duplicate transactions at support@pocketguard.com and send us a screenshot displaying the duplicated transactions, so we could troubleshoot as soon as possible.\r", 'modified': '2021-04-09T08:27:38Z'}
column3: Love the app! It‚Äôs exactly what I needed with nothing too complicated. The plus allows for budgeting and it‚Äôs worth it. I‚Äôm able to keep an eye on everything and write notes on transactions. I would give it five stars if it wasn‚Äôt for its duplicate transactions. It keeps scaring me and then when I check my bank it‚Äôs only one transactions. It‚Äôs also easy to hide it but it‚Äôs really annoying. Everything is good then all of a sudden it‚Äôs calculates something twice. Please fix.

column2: {'id': 43355527, 'body': 'Hi there! We appreciate your feedback regarding the budgeting options. We will definitely discuss this with our team for future updates to improve PocketGuard. Have a wonderful day!\r\n', 'modified': '2024-04-18T14:26:31Z'}
column3:
I switched to PocketGuard like a lot of people when mint was integrated with credit karma and they didn‚Äôt offer budgeting anymore which was my primary use for it. 
PocketGuard works really well and is user friendly. I wish there was an option for quarterly, bi-monthly, or annual budgets. I have a few and it can be frustrating to get an accurate depiction of my finances and monthly spending. Hopefully that‚Äôs something that is in development.

column2: {'id': 31075713, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for your feedback. As PocketGuard pulls financial data from your financial institutions, we don‚Äôt require you to start using the app on the 1st of the month. Even though each month you should adjust your monthly budget (since every month is different), you‚Äôre still able to review your transaction/budget history. The more you use PocketGuard, the more important insights you can get throughout our comprehensive analytics. Please, contact us at support@pocketguard.com and provide more details about the difficulties you have faced, so we could help in setting up your budget. Hope for your understanding.', 'modified': '2022-07-25T10:24:31Z'}
column3: So far, the app looks like it can be super helpful. Unfortunately, it‚Äôs super difficult for me to start using in the middle because the app starts your budget over at the beginning of each month. So if you‚Äôre jumping in midway through a month, it‚Äôs hard to figure out how to give the app insight into your current financial status. To avoid a headache, I recommend starting to use the app at the beginning of a month so you can work from a clean slate.
column7: Neat, but start using on the 1st of the month

column3: For me, this is the first budgeting app that doesn‚Äôt feel like a pain to check every day, because the format is so streamlined :D I appreciate how it shows all of my transactions for all my accounts in one real-time feed, gives a breakdown of expenses in a pie chart, and says how much money I have left to safely spend this month. I love how simple the format is, because too many bells and whistles discourage me from using apps.

I think Pocketguard app is wonderful. But don't expect any miracles unless you take budgeting seriously. Just installing the app and connecting your accounts will hardly be helpful. I recommend to set up your bills and income, check if the app detects all your merchants and categories correctly and change them if it doesn't, then set spending limits, savings goal etc. It will take some time but its totally worth it.

column2: {'id': 36306598, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for the fantastic review. We are glad that you enjoy using our app. Please feel free to contact us at support@pocketguard.com if you have any questions/suggestions. Have a great day!', 'modified': '2023-05-03T12:48:43Z'}
column3: We are new to PocketGuard and while we are still learning we are astounded by it‚Äôs ease and love seeing everything in one place. Vlad at the help desk has been quick in response. We are on our way to staying within our budget since we can look quickly at all of our spending categories and see what we've spent so far each month!

column2: {'id': 41439572, 'body': "Hi there! Thank you very much for your feedback. You are able to use Plaid and Finicity to connect all your financial institutions. If both data providers have been unsuccessful, you can try to create a manual (cash) account. Regarding the limit - this was done for security measures since we want to protect your data as much as we can. We continuously improve the app and its design as well. More to come, you can follow our What's new page on the website. Last but not least - Credit Karma doesn't have basic budgeting features such as budgeting, debt payoff plan, financial goals, etc. If you don't like our premium membership - you can simply cancel it from your device settings. Please contact us at support@pocketguard.com in case of any concerns.", 'modified': '2024-01-22T08:06:00Z'}
column3: I regret paying for this. Too many financial institutions are not supported. The limit on the number of accounts you can add at one time (even with the paid version) makes the setup take several days. The lack of a credit score tracker is noticeably absent. Also, the interface could be a lot better. Overall, PocketGuard is not terrible, but you‚Äôre paying for a service that Credit Karma and Empower do for free. If you‚Äôre looking for a single app for all your financial data this just isn‚Äôt it.
column7: Not better than the free options

column2: {'id': 7963607, 'body': "Hi Brian! We are working on the big improvement of our Recurring bills and incomes features, so the mentioned issues with bills and incomes won't occur again. However, we would like to find out more about the added bill you didn't request, so could you please reply to the email we've sent? The issue with 'in my pocket' has occurred due to the reposted transactions on the institution's end. You can find the details in the email.", 'modified': '2019-03-29T08:59:09Z'}
column3: Not sure how this is so highly rated. Definitely well designed from an aesthetic perspective but every day I log in and get wildly different "in my pocket" figures. One day it will be -$700 and the next is up to $500 with no change in my spending or pay. It often suddenly forgets my bills, adds new ones I didn't request and forgets that I have upcoming income.

column2: {'id': 6240078, 'body': 'Hi Josiah! We are really sorry for the inconvenience faced and would like to investigate the mentioned issues for you. Please contact us at support@pocketguard.com.', 'modified': '2018-12-04T16:30:55Z'}
column3: I really wanted to like this app based on the screenshots, but the experience was very clunky. I only connected one account, but the app couldn't even show accurate information about that account. It was showing bills as income and absurd negative numbers as my available cash. Couldn't make heads or tails of the information presented to me by this app!
column7: Screenshots Look Great, App is Funky

column2: {'id': 26881422, 'body': 'Did you check our updated Budget App?  \nHope you will enjoy all features: bill organizer, debt payoff planner, budget planner, and bill tracker!\n', 'modified': '2021-12-16T20:47:38Z'}
column3:
My wife and I just started using this app and it has been great so far, it‚Äôs just missing one thing... the ability to split transactions.

We often go to target or places like it where we get some groceries, some personal fun stuff, and maybe even clothes. It would be really nice not to have to check out multiple times but to split everything in app!

Other than that PocketGuard has been our favorite budgeting app so far!
column7: Please add a way to split transactions!! :)

column3: There are several reasons why I consider this app to be an amazing spending tracker: 1. PocketGuard helps me to see where did my money go by categorizing my purchase from three credit cards. 2. I have the up to date total spent as well as the one for each category which is awesome. 2. I'm able to create spending limits and track the progress. 3. All the info is displayed in a simple way.

column2: {'id': 41936599, 'body': 'Hi there! Our price has been changed 3 months ago. Our lifetime membership is still available as a discount option for those who cancel their subscription or free trial. Regarding customer service - unfortunately, we have had a huge impact due to the Mint shutdown and receive thousands of tickets every week. Please contact me directly at oleksandr@pocketguard.com, so I can help. Hope for your understanding.', 'modified': '2024-02-14T08:47:33Z'}
column3: I just signed up and found out that the price has doubled in the last few weeks and the non yearly full purchase is no longer available. After contacting customer service at least five times with no response, I dropped this app like a hot potato.  I can‚Äôt believe they charge anything with the poor service and random high pricing. I decided on Monarch and they seem great.  Good luck if you choose this app and before you sign up contact customer service and see how long they take to get back to you.

I managed to link all of my accounts: checking, several credit cards, savings accounts and even PayPal (however, with some small issues). Then got all my transactions categorized and set up bills/incomes. And that is all! My Pocket Guard was ready to go. The only thing is needed from you further - open it up several times a day and nothing more. Everything is automated. So far I am very pleased.

Works as advertised. What is frustrating, and out of their control is that major banks are cutting their connection off due to privacy.  Asked for a refund and was told to go to apple which does not give me an option for refund.  If you bank with a major bank..fair warning.  Their are connection issues that currently have zero resolution.

column2: {'id': 2064095, 'body': 'Hi there! Our tech team is very close to solving the issue. We are very sorry for the troubles caused. Hope you will enjoy PocketGuard when all your accounts are connected successfully.', 'modified': '2017-12-18T09:55:44Z'}
column3: Just downloaded this app, looking forward to using it but I can't even add my Barclay Card account. When I type in both answers to my security questions and hit "connect", nothing happens but the second answer vibrating. If I can't even add my account, what else is wrong with my app. Not using this app until this irritating problem is solved.

column2: {'id': 38281541, 'body': "Hi there! Thanks for the fantastic review! It's great to know that our budgeting features help you get a clear picture of your spending. Don't hesitate to contact our support team at support@pocketguard.com if you have any questions. By the way, if you want, you can share your user experience with other people here: www.trustpilot.com/review/pocketguard.com. Have a good day!", 'modified': '2023-08-14T12:43:18Z'}
column3: This is an awesome app for keeping track of your finances! It‚Äôs very intuitive, and I love the zero-based budgeting approach. I also love that they offer a lifetime one-time purchase option for the premium version. This app has made managing my personal budget so much easier. I recommend this to anyone who is wanting to get a better grip on their monthly spending.

Downloaded pocket guard and input my income and expenses and when I got to the page where you can input your goals, it told me I did not have sufficient income even when my Income was 900 and my expenses were 700. Tried three times but got the same result. It said I needed more income and it gave me a negative amount. No good. I deleted the app.

I don‚Äôt ever write app reviews but this app has changed my life. It is EXACTLY what I have been looking for. It helps me stay on top of my spending and the best part is that it can tell me at a glance if I have $ I can spend today (or this week) and how much. Since starting to use this app, my husband and I have finally been able to start putting away money.
column7: Easiest and best app for tracking your finances

column2: {'id': 34014537, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for your feedback! We are glad to know you enjoy using our app. Be assured that your request is noted and will be discussed internally within our team. Have a good day!\r', 'modified': '2022-12-30T15:53:35Z'}
column3:
Overall I love this app- once I figured out how to use all its functions, it‚Äôs easy to maintain and keep track of expenses and budgeting. 

The main change that I‚Äôd love to see to the app is having a way to track infrequent large expenses that don‚Äôt fit neatly into budgets such as car maintenance, emergencies, yearly vet visits, etc. I‚Äôve used this app for over a year and don‚Äôt see the need to change anytime soon!

column2: {'id': 37357966, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for the great review! We are happy to hear that you found our app helpful for your needs. Feel free to contact us at support@pocketguard.com if you have any questions/suggestions. Have a nice day!', 'modified': '2023-06-27T11:51:40Z'}
column3: Absolutely love this app so far. There are a couple tweaks I would like to see, and the mobile navigation could have clearer paths to get to all the features, without having to just hunt all over, but overall it‚Äôs really great! I prefer using it on my desktop as I am more old school but the iPhone app works well when I am on the go.

It's obvious that budgeting skills are must-have nowadays, but I am sure there are lots of people like me, who cope with the numbers poorly. Luckily we have such apps as PocketGuard! The budget is calculated automatically, the transaction history is pulled either real-time or overnight (it depends on the institution), your paychecks and bills are predicted each month, and savings goal rolls over itself. Try it and you won't regret!

I happened to find PocketGuard one day as I was scanning the App Store and I am glad I did.

The versatility of the app gives me an up to date status of where my money is/going at any given point in time. I bank at a small neighborhood bank (one that does not show up on other apps) and PocketGuard works with the bank!

I was a Quicken guy for over 10 years but this app has changed my thinking. I am going to work with PocketGuard for awhile.

I have a summer job and don't get paid regularly with fixed amounts. I thought I will have to remove the app, but there was an option to subscribe for Plus and keep tracking my cash expenses. It is really helpful so far and I am sure I will try it next year as well. Would be awesome if developers make it easier to get points for inviting friends √∞≈∏‚Ñ¢¬è

A fried of mine recommended this app to me when I was complaining that my relatively high salary is not enough for my family and we have to dip into our savings account every month. So I decided why not to try it? And you know, it's been the third month I'm using the app and the third month my family manages to stay in the budget. So now it's my turn to recommend this app to you.

column2: {'id': 28165869, 'body': 'Hi Robby! Thank you for rating our finance app. We are glad to see that the "Insights" reporting and budget tracking have met your needs. Please, contact us at support@pocketguard.com, so we could investigate the issue with accounts and report it to our data aggregation provider. Have a great day!', 'modified': '2022-02-21T09:51:05Z'}
column3:
I have enjoyed using this app. Their are a few problems with keeping accounts from not working at times but every one of these apps have the same problem. This has been my best experience with a budgeting app so far.

Helps me keep track of spending and gives me great insight and capabilities with tracking my budget.

I love their customer service / tech support. They really do work to make sure your accounts are available to add. This is definitely the best budgeting app out there that gives you a big picture view of your assets. I‚Äôve used mint and a ton of other smaller budgeting apps but this blows the rest out of the water. Also visually it‚Äôs the easiest to look at and navigate.

column2: {'id': 25095654, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for the wonderful review. We are so excited you have enjoyed our app. Feel free to contact us at support@pocketguard.com if you need help with anything in the app, and we will do our best to assist you.', 'modified': '2021-09-14T13:33:33Z'}
column3: I‚Äôm used to looking at our monthly budget in 2D, and if I wanted to do any sort of analysis, I would have to do all the work, taking hours. This 3D app does the majority of the work for me so I can step back, look at where my money is going, and start making better decisions. I haven‚Äôt even seen everything it can do yet, very excited

App has been great but every so often there are annoying bugs that make the basics of the app stop working. Used to always take forever to resolve but at least they responded. Now they‚Äôve stopped responding altogether, and I am also paying monthly for it. Guess it‚Äôs time to start looking again...

Basically, all my financial life is in one place (transactions, balances, savings, investments etc). Don't need to use multiple apps to get this all together. Moreover, it updates automatically so I am sure the fresh data was pulled. Calculates the budgets for today and for this month which helps to plan my expense and notifications won't let you overspend. Very good

I wasn't sure whether it will work for me as I get paid in the middle of the month. But the app predicted my paycheck as upcoming, so the calculations were accurate. The monthly budget depends solely on your income, bills, and spending and your account balances don't matter. It was a little hard to adjust to the new way of budgeting, but now I do feel the advantages of such an approach.

column2: {'id': 28588433, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for your feedback. We will pass your feedback to our team, so we could discuss the request internally. Meanwhile, contact us at support@pocketguard.com, so we could get a bit more details from you. Hope for your understanding.', 'modified': '2022-03-15T15:12:04Z'}
column3:
This app was almost the white unicorn of budgeting tools I always wanted. Unfortunately the lack of one feature makes it unusable for myself and my family and that is manually entered transactions to be reconciled. 

Other apps allow you to enter a transaction when it occurs, and will either automatically reconcile it from the bank if it matches, or give you the option to reconcile itself. 

This app requires the transaction to clear the bank first, which can sometimes take days. The app implies that it‚Äôs showing you your actual working balance sans upcoming bills, but a holiday weekend of transactions hitting on a Tuesday will show you it was way off. 

Fix that flaw and I‚Äôm a lifetime subscriber, but until then I have to use something else.

But until they allow you to add your own pockets I can‚Äôt. I have too many things that don‚Äôt fit the generic categories hard coded into the program, it doesn‚Äôt reflect my spending to me. Second, I have three car payments with the same lender and that prevents me from setting them up as bills, each payment overwrites the prior one. They need to allow the distinction by both payee and amount.
column7: I want to give it 5 stars

column2: {'id': 46012095, 'body': "Thank you for taking the time to leave such a detailed review. We're truly sorry for the inconvenience you've faced with the bank connection issues and the support response. We take your concerns seriously and recognize how important it is to have a reliable connection to your financial institutions. The team appreciates you bringing this to our attention and your patience as our data provider's engineers investigate further. We‚Äôll keep you updated on any progress. If you have any other feedback or questions, feel free to reach out at support@pocketguard.com.", 'modified': '2024-08-15T09:45:08Z'}
column3:
This app *could* be great. But they have some real issues with getting it to remain connected with normal, every day banking institutes. I suspect it has something to do with 2 factor authentication on my banking side. Obviously I won‚Äôt lower security measures to get an app to work. 

There‚Äôs very little by means of support. I of course was asked if I had the correct password, as if I was stupid. Then I was encouraged to change my banking password via pocket guards ‚Äúchange my password‚Äù link again like I‚Äôm stupid. There‚Äôs nothing wrong with my banking login, I can access it all fine. A few days later I received another email from support telling me it was all a mystery & they‚Äôd forward it to the engineers. So it‚Äôs anyone‚Äôs guess when it‚Äôll start working properly. 

Is pocket guard great? Nope. 

Is it good? Meh

It‚Äôs passable at this point.

column2: {'id': 34885509, 'body': 'Hi there! Thanks for your feedback. Please contact us at support@pocketguard.com so our support team can check if there are any issues that could cause such a delay. Have a nice day.', 'modified': '2023-02-15T13:15:06Z'}
column3:
It is being very helpful in tracking expenses. The only downside is that it runs 1-2 days behind the time of the actual transactions. By the time the weekend is over and transactions load on Monday night or Tuesday, it‚Äôs hard to remember what we spent on Friday and why. I wish it was more real time, like a banking app. 
However, I think for the most part, it is helping us.
